decks.notes: The main idea behind this mono blue aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By playing cheap threats like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, along with countermagic like Counterspell and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while controlling the game. Card draw spells like Deep Analysis and Thought Scour help to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on. LÃ³rien Revealed and Deem Inferior provide additional support to the aggressive game plan, making it a formidable and versatile deck in the Pauper format.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost white creatures and using token generators to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards that provide additional utility and protection for the creatures, as well as ways to gain life or prevent damage. The strategy is to apply early pressure and maintain board presence to quickly close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards like Ephemerate to blink creatures and gain advantage, as well as using counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes card draw and recursion options to maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent. The mana base includes a mix of snow lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and outlast the opponent through efficient control and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently cycle through cards in order to build up a graveyard full of creatures, then utilize spells like Reaping the Graves and Songs of the Damned to bring them back in explosive combos. The deck utilizes cards like Drannith Healer and Drannith Stinger for early game control, while also utilizing Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate mana quickly. The Architects of Will and Street Wraith help to cycle through the deck, while Imposing Vantasaur and Horror of the Broken Lands provide powerful creatures that can be brought back with the graveyard recursion spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through a combination of countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. The deck utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also generating value through cards like Murmuring Mystic and Thorn of the Black Rose. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by trading efficiently and resolving threats that can win the game if left unanswered. Additionally, the deck has some graveyard hate with Bojuka Bog and Contaminated Aquifer to disrupt graveyard-centric strategies.
